JSUnit looks interesting, but I don't think that will help with what I'm
doing.  I'm not trying to actually test JavaScript.  I have a JSP that
returns a form to the client that looks like say:

<form action="foo">
...
<a href="javascript:form.submit()">Post to foo</a>
<a href="javascript:form.action='bar';form.submit()">Post to bar</a>
</form>

Since the action attribute on the WebForm is read-only, there is no way to
test the second link, so I added a way.

It would be great if I could tell HTTPUnit to select the 'Post to bar' link
and have it actually run the JavaScript....



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Joshua Kerievsky [mailto:jlk@...]
> Sent: Thursday, February 28, 2002 4:21 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Emulating JavaScript in HTTPUnit
> 
> 
> 
> >I've got a site that uses JavaScript to change the action on 
> a form when
> >certain links are selected.  To emulate this in HTTPUnit, I 
> had to add a
> >setAction() method to com.meterware.httpunit.WebForm.java.  
> It works fine,
> >but I'd rather not use a custom version of httpunit.  Is 
> there another way
> >to do this?
> 
> Have you considered using javascript unit: JSUnit 
> (http://www.edwardh.com/jsunit/)?
> 
> regards,
